query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 Ne l’ora che non può ’l calor dïurno 2 intepidar più ’l freddo de la luna, 3 vinto da terra, e talor da Saturno
4 —quando i geomanti lor Maggior Fortuna 5 veggiono in orïente, innanzi a l’alba, 6 surger per via che poco le sta bruna—,
7 mi venne in sogno una femmina balba, 8 ne li occhi guercia, e sovra i piè distorta, 9 con le man monche, e di colore scialba.
query.result:
1 In the hour when the heat of day cannot 2 warm the cold of the moon any longer, 3 overcome by the earth, and sometimes by Saturn
4 —when the geomancers see their Major Fortune 5 in the east, before dawn, 6 rise along a path that is barely dark for it—,
7 a stammering woman came to me in a dream, 8 squinting in her eyes, and twisted in her feet, 9 with mutilated hands, and of a pale color.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
10 Io la mirava; e come ’l sol conforta 11 le fredde membra che la notte aggrava, 12 così lo sguardo mio le facea scorta
13 la lingua, e poscia tutta la drizzava 14 in poco d’ora, e lo smarrito volto, 15 com’ amor vuol, così le colorava.
query.result:
10 I looked at her; and as the sun comforts 11 the cold limbs that the night weighs down, 12 so my gaze made her tongue nimble,
13 and then straightened her whole body 14 in a short time, and her lost complexion, 15 as love wills, it colored for her.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
16 Poi ch’ell’ avea ’l parlar così disciolto, 17 cominciava a cantar sì, che con pena 18 da lei avrei mio intento rivolto.
query.result: 16 After she had thus loosened her speech, 17 she began to sing so sweetly that with difficulty 18 would I have turned my attention away from her.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
19 «Io son», cantava, «io son dolce serena, 20 che ’ marinari in mezzo mar dismago; 21 tanto son di piacere a sentir piena!
22 Io volsi Ulisse del suo cammin vago 23 al canto mio; e qual meco s’ausa, 24 rado sen parte; sì tutto l’appago!».
query.result:
19 "I am," she sang, "I am the sweet siren, 20 who bewilders sailors in the middle of the sea; 21 so full of pleasure am I to hear!
22 I turned Ulysses from his desired path 23 with my song; and whoever gets used to me, 24 rarely leaves me; so much do I satisfy him!"

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
25 Ancor non era sua bocca richiusa, 26 quand’ una donna apparve santa e presta 27 lunghesso me per far colei confusa.
query.result: 25 Her mouth was not yet closed, 26 when a holy and quick woman appeared 27 beside me to confound her.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
28 «O Virgilio, Virgilio, chi è questa?», 29 fieramente dicea; ed el venìa 30 con li occhi fitti pur in quella onesta.
query.result: 28 "O Virgil, Virgil, who is this?", 29 she said fiercely; and he came 30 with his eyes fixed only on that virtuous woman.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
31 L’altra prendea, e dinanzi l’apria 32 fendendo i drappi, e mostravami ’l ventre; 33 quel mi svegliò col puzzo che n’uscia.

Please translate literally into English.
34 Io mossi li occhi, e ’l buon maestro: «Almen tre 35 voci t’ho messe!», dicea, «Surgi e vieni; 36 troviam l’aperta per la qual tu entre».

Please translate literally into English.
37 Sù mi levai, e tutti eran già pieni 38 de l’alto dì i giron del sacro monte, 39 e andavam col sol novo a le reni.
query.result: 37 I rose, and already all the circles 38 of the sacred mountain were filled with the high day, 39 and we walked with the new sun at our backs.

40 Following him, I held my head 41 like one who has it laden with thought, 42 who makes of himself a half-arch of a bridge;
43 when I heard "Come; here one crosses over" 44 spoken in a gentle and kind manner, 45 such as is not heard in this mortal realm.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
46 Con l’ali aperte, che parean di cigno, 47 volseci in sù colui che sì parlonne 48 tra due pareti del duro macigno.
query.result: 46 With his wings spread, which seemed like a swan's, 47 he who spoke to us thus turned us upward 48 between two walls of hard rock.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
49 Mosse le penne poi e ventilonne, 50 ‘Qui lugent’ affermando esser beati, 51 ch’avran di consolar l’anime donne.
query.result: 49 Then he moved his wings and fanned them, 50 affirming that those who mourn are blessed, 51 for they shall have the holy souls to console them.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
52 «Che hai che pur inver’ la terra guati?», 53 la guida mia incominciò a dirmi, 54 poco amendue da l’angel sormontati.
query.result: 52 "What is the matter with you that you keep looking down at the earth?", 53 my guide began to say to me, 54 both of us having just been passed by the angel.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
55 E io: «Con tanta sospeccion fa irmi 56 novella visïon ch’a sé mi piega, 57 sì ch’io non posso dal pensar partirmi».
query.result: 55 And I: "With so much suspicion does a new vision make me stand firm 56 that bends me toward itself, 57 so that I cannot tear myself away from thinking about it."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
58 «Vedesti», disse, «quell’antica strega 59 che sola sovr’ a noi omai si piagne; 60 vedesti come l’uom da lei si slega.

Please translate literally into English.
61 Bastiti, e batti a terra le calcagne; 62 li occhi rivolgi al logoro che gira 63 lo rege etterno con le rote magne».

Please translate literally into English.
64 Quale ’l falcon, che prima a’ pié si mira, 65 indi si volge al grido e si protende 66 per lo disio del pasto che là il tira,
67 tal mi fec’ io; e tal, quanto si fende 68 la roccia per dar via a chi va suso, 69 n’andai infin dove ’l cerchiar si prende.
query.result:
64 Like the falcon, who first looks at his feet, 65 then turns to the call and stretches himself out 66 for the desire of the food that draws him there,
67 so did I; and so, as much as the rock is split 68 to give way to him who goes up, 69 I went until I reached where the circling begins.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
70 Com’ io nel quinto giro fui dischiuso, 71 vidi gente per esso che piangea, 72 giacendo a terra tutta volta in giuso.
query.result: 70 As I was revealed in the fifth circle, 71 I saw people weeping through it, 72 lying on the ground, all turned face down.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
73 ‘Adhaesit pavimento anima mea’ 74 sentia dir lor con sì alti sospiri, 75 che la parola a pena s’intendea.
query.result: 73 "My soul cleaves to the dust" 74 I heard them say with such deep sighs, 75 that the words were barely intelligible.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
76 «O eletti di Dio, li cui soffriri 77 e giustizia e speranza fa men duri, 78 drizzate noi verso li alti saliri».
query.result: 76 "O chosen of God, whose suffering 77 both justice and hope make less harsh, 78 direct us toward the high ascents."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
79 «Se voi venite dal giacer sicuri, 80 e volete trovar la via più tosto, 81 le vostre destre sien sempre di fori».
query.result: 79 "If you come from lying down safely, 80 and you want to find the way more quickly, 81 let your right hands always be on the outside."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
82 Così pregò ’l poeta, e sì risposto 83 poco dinanzi a noi ne fu; per ch’io 84 nel parlare avvisai l’altro nascosto,
85 e volsi li occhi a li occhi al segnor mio: 86 ond’ elli m’assentì con lieto cenno 87 ciò che chiedea la vista del disio.
query.result:
82 Thus the poet prayed, and thus was answered 83 a short distance ahead of us; wherefore I 84 perceived the other hidden in the speech,
85 and turned my eyes to the eyes of my lord: 86 whereupon he assented to me with a joyful nod 87 to what the sight of desire asked.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
88 Poi ch’io potei di me fare a mio senno, 89 trassimi sovra quella creatura 90 le cui parole pria notar mi fenno,
91 dicendo: «Spirto in cui pianger matura 92 quel sanza ’l quale a Dio tornar non pòssi, 93 sosta un poco per me tua maggior cura.
query.result:
88 After I was able to do with myself as I pleased, 89 I drew myself toward that creature 90 whose words had first made me take note,
91 saying: "Spirit in whom weeping ripens 92 that without which one cannot return to God, 93 pause a little for me your greater care.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
94 Chi fosti e perché vòlti avete i dossi 95 al sù, mi dì, e se vuo’ ch’io t’impetri 96 cosa di là ond’ io vivendo mossi».
query.result: 94 Who were you and why have you turned your backs 95 to the ascent, tell me, and if you want me to obtain for you 96 something from there whence I set out alive."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
97 Ed elli a me: «Perché i nostri diretri 98 rivolga il cielo a sé, saprai; ma prima 99 scias quod ego fui successor Petri.
query.result: 97 And he to me: "Why heaven turns our backs 98 toward itself, you shall know; but first 99 know that I was the successor of Peter.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
100 Intra Sïestri e Chiaveri s’adima 101 una fiumana bella, e del suo nome 102 lo titol del mio sangue fa sua cima.
query.result: 100 Between Sestri and Chiavari winds 101 a beautiful river, and from its name 102 the title of my blood takes its summit.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
103 Un mese e poco più prova’ io come 104 pesa il gran manto a chi dal fango il guarda, 105 che piuma sembran tutte l’altre some.
query.result: 103 A month and little more did I experience how 104 heavy the great mantle weighs on him who guards it from the mire, 105 that makes all other burdens seem like feathers.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
106 La mia conversïone, omè!, fu tarda; 107 ma, come fatto fui roman pastore, 108 così scopersi la vita bugiarda.

Please translate literally into English.
109 Vidi che lì non s’acquetava il core, 110 né più salir potiesi in quella vita; 111 per che di questa in me s’accese amore.

Please translate literally into English.
112 Fino a quel punto misera e partita 113 da Dio anima fui, del tutto avara; 114 or, come vedi, qui ne son punita.

Please translate literally into English.
115 Quel ch’avarizia fa, qui si dichiara 116 in purgazion de l’anime converse; 117 e nulla pena il monte ha più amara.

Please translate literally into English.
118 Sì come l’occhio nostro non s’aderse 119 in alto, fisso a le cose terrene, 120 così giustizia qui a terra il merse.
query.result: 118 Just as our eye did not lift itself 119 on high, fixed on earthly things, 120 so justice here has sunk it to the ground.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
121 Come avarizia spense a ciascun bene 122 lo nostro amore, onde operar perdési, 123 così giustizia qui stretti ne tene,
124 ne’ piedi e ne le man legati e presi; 125 e quanto fia piacer del giusto Sire, 126 tanto staremo immobili e distesi».
query.result:
121 As avarice extinguished our love for every good, 122 whereby action was lost, 123 so justice here holds us tightly bound,
124 bound and seized in our feet and hands; 125 and as long as it shall please the just Lord, 126 so long shall we remain motionless and outstretched."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
127 Io m’era inginocchiato e volea dire; 128 ma com’ io cominciai ed el s’accorse, 129 solo ascoltando, del mio reverire,
130 «Qual cagion», disse, «in giù così ti torse?».
query.result:
127 I had knelt down and wanted to speak; 128 but as I began and he perceived, 129 just by listening, my reverence,
130 "What reason," he said, "has twisted you down so?"

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
131 E io a lui: «Per vostra dignitate 132 mia coscïenza dritto mi rimorse».
133 «Drizza le gambe, lèvati sù, frate!», 134 rispuose; «non errar: conservo sono 135 teco e con li altri ad una podestate.
query.result:
131 And I to him: "Because of your dignity 132 my conscience rightly pricked me."
133 "Straighten your legs, get up, brother!" 134 he replied; "do not err: I am a fellow servant 135 with you and with the others to the same power.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
136 Se mai quel santo evangelico suono 137 che dice ‘Neque nubent’ intendesti, 138 ben puoi veder perch’ io così ragiono.
query.result: 136 If ever you understood that holy Gospel sound 137 that says 'Nor shall they marry', 138 you can well see why I speak thus.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
139 Vattene omai: non vo’ che più t’arresti; 140 ché la tua stanza mio pianger disagia, 141 col qual maturo ciò che tu dicesti.

query.result:
142 I have a granddaughter there whose name is Alagia, 143 good in herself, provided that our house 144 does not make her wicked by example;
145 and she alone remains to me from there."
